entities: United Nations Verification Mission in Colombia
summary:
The Security Council, reaffirming its commitment to Colombia's peace process, recalls its previous resolutions and statements, and welcomes progress made towards peace. It urges parties to work together to implement the Final Agreement. Recalling resolution 2366 (2017), it established the UN Verification Mission in Colombia to verify implementation of the Final Agreement by the Government and FARC-EP. 
1. Decides to extend the Verification Mission's mandate to 25 September 2019, with reporting requirements as in resolutions 2366 and 2377 (2017), headed by a Special Representative of the Secretary-General. 
2. Expresses willingness to further extend the mandate based on agreement between the parties.
